A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In post- colonial 1960s Ireland, a girl with Dystonia – a neurological disorder leading to uncontrolled and severe muscle spasms which makes horses quite nervous - takes over Horse Whisperer duties so the family can pay off the loans. They begin a battle against nature and tradition while dealing with their respective families

Although there is melodrama at the center or rather at the bottom of this film, the story is told beautifully and subtly and the acting is superb.

For a dystopian piece on 'race relations' and perhaps an even more important question about survival through genetics in general, it could win some Academy Awards, I would say. Especially if you like acting.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on his friendship with a thief called Musashi, the film takes place at the beginning of the Showa period when Japan was undergoing rapid change from Meiji era isolationism to globalised modernity. Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming.
I could tell that the people working behind the scenes really cared about their film. They may not be professionals by trade or training (possibly possible), but they went above and beyond to make a wonderful short film.
The story is told excellently through dialogue and action. The comedic timing of Elias Plymale is top notch

I'd even say some shades of Hitchcock...this is clearly better than MMM, which is seen as a guilty pleasure by some if not most Woody fans.
